posts.post_content:
Best card to combine with is [Godo, Bandit Warlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Godo, Bandit Warlord). Not just because he's a Legendary Red Creature but because he can summon it for free! Plus, it's his anyway.  
I use it in a {R}{W} Spirit Samurai deck and it can end up also getting equipped to [Brothers Yamazaki](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brothers Yamazaki). Of course, other Legendary creatures including Red Spirits can also benefit greatly!
posts.html:
Best card to combine with is Godo, Bandit Warlord. Not just because he's a Legendary Red Creature but because he can summon it for free! Plus, it's his anyway.
I use it in a {R}{W} Spirit Samurai deck and it can end up also getting equipped to Brothers Yamazaki. Of course, other Legendary creatures including Red Spirits can also benefit greatly!

Rating:

posts.post_content: The orginal idea behind this card was that it was only of use to a limited number of red Legendary creatures. However with [Lovisa Coldeyes](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lovisa Coldeyes ) and her Barbarian/Berserker/Warrior pump ability means that it has a place in deck built around her. With [Kamahl, Pit Fighter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kamahl, Pit Fighter), [Jeska, Warrior Adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jeska, Warrior Adept), [Godo, Bandit Warlord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Godo, Bandit Warlord) and Lovisa all meeting the card requirements to get full use out of this card its not longer so bad. It still isn't [Umezawa's Jitte](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Umezawa's Jitte), but what do you want their Barbarians and Barbarians just go...SMASH!
posts.html:

posts.post_content: Playing this card on [Jeska, Warrior adept](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jeska, Warrior adept) will make a 6/4 trample, first strike, haste, that can tap to add to her own power or take out a weenie. This is legal because after blockers are declared you can tap cards, and use her effect.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Since it's only really good when used on red legends, this could either have been made slightly cheaper or simply provided more unconditional effects.  
Even if all of it was unconditional (which would make this card again very powerful yet destroy the flavour of this card), it would not have been able to compete with the other [infamous legendary equipment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=81979) from Betrayers of Kamigawa.  
  
Well, it's still not that bad with [the most obvious card to combine with](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=78192), though.  
Downside here? The legend you're going to equip this with is already rather overcosted.
posts.html:
Since it's only really good when used on red legends, this could either have been made slightly cheaper or simply provided more unconditional effects.
Even if all of it was unconditional (which would make this card again very powerful yet destroy the flavour of this card), it would not have been able to compete with the other infamous legendary equipment from Betrayers of Kamigawa.

Well, it's still not that bad with the most obvious card to combine with, though.
Downside here? The legend you're going to equip this with is already rather overcosted.

posts.post_content:
If I were ever in a situation where I had to make an improvised club from a log, I certainly wouldn't *name* it. I mean, it's a log. It's going to *rot* eventually. And even before then the chain will break. So what does he do with the next one? Does that become Tenza II? Hehe, sounds like some cr@p 80s action movie series. Tenza II- Godo's Retaliation, Tenza III- Godos' Vengeance, Tenza IV- Godo Bloody Godo.  
  
Oh yeah, the card itself sucks. If you don't have red or legendary creatures out, it's just an overpriced legendary [leonin scimitar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=leonin scimitar). If you have a legend out, it's a total of 4 mana to give a creature a continuous [giant growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=giant growth). If you have a red guy out, it's 4 mana for a trampling scimitar. And even if you have a both ridiculous conditionals met, you just have a creature with +3/+3 trample. What if that creature gets blasted? Have fun trying to equip it to something else and getting a no doubt tiny effect.  
  
Run [Coloss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Coloss)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
